We are DR Power, a Generac Company, professional power equipment done right.

Established in 1985, we are a leader in the design and manufacture of professional-grade gas and battery-powered outdoor power equipment. We are dedicated to the enduring quality and uncompromising performance of everything we build. We stand behind every DR® product and are here to help every customer regardless of when or where they made their initial purchase.

DR Power’s Engineering Intern position is responsible to work with other engineers to fulfill special design requests on our products. Under supervision of engineers, the intern will create definitions of parts and assemblies in the form of 2D cross sections, 3D models, tolerance stack-ups, and various electronic data formats to support analysis, manufacturing, assembly and service. Participants develop technical skills through challenging assignments and usage of technical tools.

This position is based onsite at our South Burlington, VT office.

Job Duties:

  • Designs, validates, and brings new products to market.

  • Provide new product development support in the Industrial, Commercial, Residential and/or Retail outdoor power equipment product area including; Creating and maintaining CAD models, drawings, and BOMs, Supporting product development plans (schedule, product cost, meeting design inputs), Interfacing with internal company personnel, Provide technical support for assigned projects.

  • Specifies precise new product functional requirements; designs, tests and integrates standard, less complex components to produce final designs; and evaluates the design's overall effectiveness, cost (including cost/benefit analysis), reliability (risk analysis), and safety.

  • Designs, develops, executes and evaluates fitness-for-use testing, product specifications and process validation plans for standard products and/or components; creates and reviews material part specifications and bills of materials.

  • Collaborates with internal manufacturing partners, designers and product specialists to optimize basic designs for manufacturability.

  • Utilizes CAD (Computer Aided Design) or CAE (Computer Aided Engineering) systems to model new designs and produce detailed engineering drawings.

  • Supporting product development plans (schedule, product cost, meeting design inputs)

  • Other duties as assigned.

Education, Skills & Experience:

  • Currently pursuing a BS degree (preferably in Mechanical, Electrical, or Industrial Engineering).

  • Available to work Summer 2026 between May and August for 40 hours per week.

  • Understanding or working knowledge of Pro-E and/or AutoCAD experience.

  • Microsoft Office experience (including Excel).

Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear; and use hands to manipulate objects or controls. The employee is regularly required to stand and walk. On occasion the incumbent may be required to stoop, bend or reach above the shoulders. The employee must occasionally lift up to 25 pounds. Specific conditions of this job are typical of frequent and continuous computer-based work requiring periods of sitting, close vision and ability to adjust focus. Occasional travel.

“We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.”

When you apply, a Cisco representative may contact you directly if a relevant position opens.</p><p></p><p></p><div><div><p><span><span>Applications are accepted until further notice. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Meet the Team </span></b><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><span><span>Cisco Security Customer Experience (CX) organization supports customers through the entire lifecycle of a security solution: from understanding business needs to deploying custom solutions, from </span><span>optimizing</span><span> existing solutions to developing applications that meets specific needs; from helping customers to </span><span>maintain</span><span> their solution</span></span><span><span>s to helping them investigate poten</span></span><span><span>tial security incidents. As a Security Consulting Engineer Intern, you will be able to interact with customers and learn how Cisco plan, design, deploy and </span><span>optimize</span><span> Security Solution while </span><span>acquiring</span><span> the technical and consultative skills </span><span>required</span><span> to accurately delight Cisco customers. During the internship you will also </span><span>have the opportunity to</span><span> interact with other Cisco organizations and learn how they contribute to </span><span>enable</span><span> our customers to achieve their business goals. </span></span><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Your Impact </span></b><span> </span></p><p></p></div><div><p><span><span>Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more relevant than ever. Our employees have groundbreaking ideas that impact everything imaginable - from entertainment, retail, healthcare, and education, to public and private sectors, smart cities, smart cars, and everyday devices in our homes. Here, that means </span><span>you’ll</span><span> take creative ideas from the drawing board to powerful solutions that have real world impact. </span><span>You’ll</span><span> collaborate with Cisco leaders, partner with expert mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected. </span><span>You’ll</span><span> be part of a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and </span><span>you’ll</span><span> </span><span>participate</span><span> in changing the lives of those in our local communities. Come prepared to be inspired. </span></span><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will attend on-site design and configuration sessions with a Security Consulting mentor </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will collect requirements from customers for projects to meet critical business goals </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will work with a team mentor to define the business goals and requirements for integration efforts </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will aid in analyzing and designing policy creation for Identity Services, Firewalls, Visibility </span><span>Solutions</span><span> and Cloud-based solutions. </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will analyze customer configurations and provide feedback on </span><span>possible improvements</span><span> to the configuration to improve alignment with customer business goals </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will learn and understand Security Policies, Standards, Procedures and Guidelines </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>You will be able to </span><span>demonstrate</span><span> programming languages (Java/Python/C++) and </span><span>open source</span><span> automation platforms (Ansible/Chef/Terraform) to develop tailor-made automation capabilities to customers using Cisco application programming interfaces </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul><p></p></div><div><p><b><span>Minimum Qualifications </span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Currently enrolled in a certification program (e.g., Boot Camp, Apprenticeship, Community College</span><span>), or</span><span> currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program. Relevant fields </span><span>include:</span><span> in Information Systems, Cyber Security, Computer Networking, Computer Science or Engineering </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Knowledge of IT systems, networking concepts, TCP/IP protocols, network </span><span>devices</span><span> and applications, OSI 7-layer model, or code development </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Able to legally live and work in the country for which </span><span>you’re</span><span> applying, without visa support or sponsorship </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><p><span> </span></p></div><div><p><b><span>Preferred Qualifications </span></b><span> </span></p></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>A desire and passion for Information Security and willingness to learn and guide yourself tough concepts </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div></div><div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Able to work well in small dynamic teams and balance multiple responsibilities </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>The ability and desire to work on collaborative teams across the US </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Comfortable handling ambiguity and unknowns associated with technical projects </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Self-motivated individual that feels comfortable working on remote teams </span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div><div><ul><li><p><span><span>Possess excellent written and verbal skills</span></span><span> </span></p></li></ul></div></div><p></p><h1>Why Cisco? </h1><p>At Cisco, we’re revolutionizing how data and infrastructure connect and protect organizations in the AI era – and beyond. We’ve been innovating fearlessly for 40 years to create solutions that power how humans and technology work together across the physical and digital worlds. These solutions provide customers with unparalleled security, visibility, and insights across the entire digital footprint.</p><p>Fueled by the depth and breadth of our technology, we experiment and create meaningful solutions. Add to that our worldwide network of doers and experts, and you’ll see that the opportunities to grow and build are limitless. We work as a team, collaborating with empathy to make really big things happen on a global scale. Because our solutions are everywhere, our impact is everywhere. </p><p>We are Cisco, and our power starts with you. </p><p></p>
